headline: CNN 10
subHeadline: Cyclone Gabrielle Hits New Zealand; Ohio Toxic Train Spill. Aired 4- 4:10a ET

utterances.speaker: CARROLL
utterances.sentences: Reese says she has been drinking bottled water instead of well water ever since she started spotting dead fish in the creek following thederailment. She says she`s still waiting for the state to come and test her well water.

utterances.speaker: REESE
utterances.sentences: Air wise, I feel OK. Water wise, no. No. There`s just too many chemicals and stuff that were spilled that they still don`t want toidentify completely.

utterances.speaker: CARROLL
utterances.sentences: An Ohio Department of Natural Resources official estimates some 3,500 fish in the state have died following the train derailment. Thesepeople saw the flames from their homes and worried their neighborhood still may not be safe. What about testing water or ground?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Nothing yet.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: And I get that I don`t recommend you put anything in the ground. I mean, vegetables or tomatoes or anything this year because wedon`t know.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I don`t think they`re going to do enough.

utterances.speaker: CARROLL
utterances.sentences: And some residents say they have been frustrated by what they describe as a lack of communication with officials on the ground.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: We pass all of the creeks and there`s crew after crew with white hoses and black hoses all through the creeks, they`re nottelling us why, and this is daily. I`m driving my children to school past all of this and they`re asking me questions that I don`t have answers to.

utterances.speaker: CARROLL
utterances.sentences: Some of their questions unanswered. We found getting information just as challenging.OK, just tell me, are they pumping water out or pumping water back in?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: You can talk to the guys up in top of the hill, sir. We`re just grunts.

utterances.speaker: CARROLL
utterances.sentences: We`re just trying to get a sense of what those pumps are. Can just -- someone just --

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Norfolk Southern can tell you everything. That`s the hotline. They can tell you everything.

utterances.speaker: CARROLL
utterances.sentences: But you realize people are calling this number and no one is getting back to them.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We`re just told to direct people to that number.

utterances.speaker: CARROLL
utterances.sentences: The governor asked by reporters Tuesday if he would feel comfortable living in East Palestine.GOV. MIKE DEWINE (R), OHIO:  I think that I would be drinking the bottled water. And I would be continuing to find out what the tests were showing as far as the air. I would be alert and concerned, but I think I would probably be back in my house.

utterances.speaker: CARROLL
utterances.sentences: But residents like Kathy Reese say they are left with few choices.

utterances.speaker: REESE
utterances.sentences: Just, I guess, pray and keep drink a bottled water until we know for sure what`s going on.(END VIDEOTAPE)

utterances.speaker: WIRE
utterances.sentences: Ten-second triviaWhich of these is the most visited urban park in the U.S.? Golden Gate Park in San Francisco, D.C.`s National Mall, Central Park in New York or the Lincoln Park in Chicago. With 40 million annual visitors, Central Park is the most visited city park in the U.S. The park is also home to a wide range of wildlife as you can imagine but a newcomer is getting most of the attention right now. Flaco, the owl, escaped from the Central Park Zoo and is at large and on the loose in the park. The rare Eurasian eagle owl escaped his enclosure on February 2nd, and since then, zoo officials have kept an eye on the bird which has become a bit of a celebrity. While Flaco seems to be adapting well to the wild, there are some concerns over how he might adapt to that New York City lifestyle. (BEGIN VIDEOTAPE) JEANNE MOOS, CNN CORRESPONDENT (voice over):  There`s a new star in Central Park and he`s right out of central casting. Lately, bird watchers only have eyes for owls. And some fans on David Barrett`s burger blog are saying.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Let Flaco be free.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: In the beginning of February Flaco escaped from his exhibit at the Central Park Zoo after someone cut through the stainless steel mesh. Hisenclosure didn`t have room to do much flying. In his first night of freedom, the NYPD almost corralled him on a Fifth Avenue sidewalk. "Well, that was a hoot," the NYPD tweeted when the owl flew off.

utterances.speaker: EDMUND BERRY, BIRDER EYEWITNESS
utterances.sentences: I was worried that it wouldn`t be able to fly but it spread its wings and flew to the nearest set of trees.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Zoo officials were most worried that Flaco didn`t know how to hunt since he`s always had his meals delivered. They tried to learn them using awhite wrapped in a cage hoping he gets trapped in the wiry filaments on top.

utterances.speaker: DAVID BARRETT, MANHATTAN BIRD ALERT
utterances.sentences: The zoo team was rushing with nets to get Flaco but Flaco was too fast.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: And now fans are snapping photos of Flaco catching his own dinner.

utterances.speaker: BARRETT
utterances.sentences: Rats.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: Rats on the menu.Barrett says the owl`s gone from zero hunting skills to decent hunting skills.

utterances.speaker: BARRETT
utterances.sentences: That`s just an incredible transformation.

utterances.speaker: MOOS
utterances.sentences: He hangs out in Central Park charming New Yorkers with hooting so low it requires subtitles. Like other creatures not native to Central Park,Flaco the Eurasian Eagle Owl has become one of the select few. (END VIDEOTAPE)
